info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 3:12PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Missoula and north central Granite Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 310 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles west of Drummond, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of water in poor drainage areas from heavy rainfall. Locations impacted include... Interstate 90 between mile markers 128 and 137. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
